titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Art Poster File
circa 1890-1910 (bulk, 1895-1896)
PR 55-1
titlestmt.author: N-YHS staff; database migrated to Archivist Toolkit by Jennifer Gargiulo, 2016

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-28 14:17:25 -0500.

did.unittitle: Art Poster file
did.abstract: The Art Posters include advertisements for books, magazines, and newspapers
did.physloc: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: This collection is primarily visual. Any text is likely to be in English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The posters come from a variety of donors.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is organized in three series:
Series I. Magazine and Journal Posters
Series II. Book Posters
Series III. Newspaper Posters

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Art Posters include colorful advertisements for books, magazines and newspapers. They were produced during a brief American art poster craze, launched in the 1890s when New York publishers hired illustrators Aubrey Beardsley, Elisha Brown Bird, William H. Bradley, George Reiter Brill, William L. Carqueville, George Wharton Edwards, Charles Dana Gibson, Archie Gunn, Ernest Haskell, Edward Penfield, Nelly Umbstaetter, Henry Sumner Watson, Charles Hubbard Wright, and others to create striking graphic advertising posters to sell their monthly magazines. The bold, clever images, inspired by French art styles and the Arts and Crafts movement, became so collectible that publishers switched to monthly pictorial covers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Art Poster File, PR 55-1, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, the New-York Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Art posters from this same time period can also be found in the Bella C. Landauer Collection of Advertising and Business Ephemera (PR 031). Other posters can be found in the Poster File (PR 055).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Art Posters File consists of approximately 612 striking prints used to advertise magazines, books, and newspapers. Notable artists include Edward Penfied and Joseph J. Gould. Art Posters make up Series I of a larger Poster File (PR 055) held by the Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

did.unittitle: Series I. Magazine and Journal Posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Magazine and Journal Posters, contains 378 posters that date from 1890 to 1910.
Posters are arranged alphabetically by journal and then chronologically. Each poster has been assigned an item number based on this arrangement. Posters are housed in flat files by item number.
Artists, where identified, are listed in parentheses after the magazine title.

Series II. Book Posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains 100 posters that date from 1890 to 1907. These posters advertise individual titles or several books from the same publisher. Publishing companies include Charles Scribner's Sons, Century Co., D. Appleton and Co., Dodd, Mead and Co., Harper and Bros., J.B. Lippincott Co., all of New York, and Lee and Shephard of Boston.
Book Posters are filed alphabetically by book title. Each poster has been assigned an item number based on that arrangment. All the posters are housed in flat files by item number.
Artists, where identified, are listed in parentheses after the book title.

Series III. Newspaper Posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Newspaper Posters, contains 134 posters from 1895 and 1896. Posters primarily advertise New York daily and Sunday papers. A few posters from other East Coast cities are also included.

Newspaper Posters are organized alphabetically by periodical, and then filed by date. Each poster has been assigned an item number based on that arrangement and are housed in flat files by item number.
Artists, where identified, are listed in parantheses after the newspaper title.
